page.title: 01Summary of Kirton Area
page.content: Kirton is a large village with a population of approximately 7,000 people. It is situated four miles S.W of Boston and is surrounded by fertile arable land ,which produces crops of cereals, brassicas and salad crops.To the East is the marsh and from there you may see large ships on their way to and from Boston Docks.There is a wide ,open landscape in all directions where beautiful sunsets can be enjoyed.In the centre of the village stands the church ,surrounded by seveal trees.There are shops of all kinds where people from outlying disricts can buy their food and other necessary goods.The centre of the village is made up of older properties but during the past 25 years three new housing estates have been built on the perimeter of the village.
